Authors:
Renan Nascimento Barbosa, Jadson Diogo Pereira Bezerra,
Teun Boekhout, Gladstone Alves Silva, Cristina Maria Souza-Motta, Neiva
Tinti Oliveira
Title: Blastobotrys meliponae
Abstract:
A new species of the genus Blastobotrys was isolated from
honey of Melipona scutellaris in Brazil collected in the Atlantic Forest
area at the Zoo Botanical Park DoisIrm√£os, Recife, Pernambuco state.
Sequencing of the large subunit rDNA gene (D1/D2 domains) and
physiological characterization revealed its distinct taxonomic position.
Three strains formed a distinct clade in D1/D2 LSU rDNA tree being most
related to B. attinorum (92 % similarity), B. proliferans (91%) and B.
nivea (90%). The strains showed phenotypic properties in common and were
distinguished from B. nivea, B. aristata, and B. proliferans. According
to these results the name Blastobotrysmeliponaeis proposed for the new
species.
